meanings.definition: A domesticated pig, especially one weighing over 120 pounds
meanings.sent1: The hog in the farm is so big that it needs a special pen.
meanings.sent2: The farmer raised a hog that won first prize at the county fair.
meanings.sent3: The hog happily rolled in the mud, enjoying its freedom.
meanings.sent4: The hog of a pig was so massive, it seemed like a giant among its peers.
meanings.sent5: Children visiting the farm were amazed by the enormous hog.

meanings.definition: To greedily take more than one's fair share of something
meanings.sent1: Don't hog all the cookies; leave some for others to enjoy.
meanings.sent2: He tends to hog the spotlight during group presentations.
meanings.sent3: She would hog the swings at the park, not letting anyone else play.
meanings.sent4: The wealthy businessman would hog resources, leaving others with little.
meanings.sent5: During the game, he would hog the ball, not passing it to his teammates.

meanings.definition: A motorcycle, especially a large one
meanings.sent1: He rode his hog through the winding roads of the countryside.
meanings.sent2: The bikers gathered at the bar with their hogs parked outside.
meanings.sent3: The hog roared to life as he revved the engine, ready to hit the road.
meanings.sent4: The shiny chrome on his hog gleamed under the sun.
meanings.sent5: She loved the feeling of freedom riding her hog on the open highway.

meanings.definition: To hoard or store something in a greedy or selfish manner
meanings.sent1: She would hog all the best books in the library, not sharing with others.
meanings.sent2: The squirrel would hog all the nuts, storing them away for winter.
meanings.sent3: He would hog all the blankets on the couch, leaving none for his family.
meanings.sent4: The collector would hog rare stamps, never trading or selling them.
meanings.sent5: The dragon in the story would hog all the treasure, not letting anyone near it.
